iati-activity.title: Lilongwe & Districts CEC
iati-activity.description:
The project aims at developing an efficient and sustainable system for delivery of eye care services through the Primary Eye Care Strategy (PEC), focusing on two major objectives:
1. To Promote and demonstrate Primary Eye Care as a means of cost effective delivery of eye health services. 2. To strengthen systems for effective integration of eye health into district health plans;
With the following key activities: ? Capacity building of health workers  equipping them with knowledge and skills in Primary Eye Care. ? Strengthening referral protocols for eye health services. ? Provision of vital supplies and support for surgeries. ? Provision of eye surgical equipment for district hospital theatres. ? Advocacy for District Health Offices to fully integrate eye health services into district health plans.
The following outcomes are expected: ? Integration of eye health into the district health systems ? Increased uptake of eye care services by community members ? Strengthened role of communities and their institutions in delivery of and demand for eye health services

iati-activity.title: Disability and Social Inclusion Advocacy
iati-activity.description:
Federation of Disability Organisations in Malawi (FEDOMA) is implementing the programme which is aimed at providing a unified voice for all persons with disabilities through lobbying and advocacy activities towards an inclusive Malawi. The objectives of the programme are: ? To equip DPOs/BPOs with skills and knowledge that will facilitate achievement of their rights ? To ensure existence of a legally enabling policy environment that promotes equality for all persons. ? To increase community awareness on their role in disability issues.
Key activities include: ? Advocate and influence implementation of disability policy. ? Coordinate and strengthen the capacity of the affiliated DPOs. ? Advocate for and monitor the equalisation of opportunities for people with disabilities as stipulated in the United Nations Standard Rules and in Malawis Disability Act.
The programme is expected to improve public attitudes and practices towards persons with disabilities

iati-activity.title: Malawi Integrated Education Programme - MIEP C&M
iati-activity.description:
The overall purpose of the project was to ensure that all blind and low vision children of school-going age in the programme districts have increased access to quality education and have the same opportunities as their sighted peers.
Key activities include: ? Developing human resources in the pilot districts of Chikwawa and Blantyre. ? Strengthening coordination capacity for the delivery of Special Needs Education. ? Advocating for Special Needs Education to be adequately resourced. ? Monitoring implementation of Special Needs Education policy guidelines in Chikwawa and Blantyre districts. ? Clinical re-assessment of children in the programme ? Facilitate procurement and provision of teaching and learning materials
Currently MCO is initiating development of a concept note which will be informed by the findings of a Situational Analysis which was conducted in Aug 2012. Stakeholder feedback and mobilisation is planned for July which will also inform the design of the follow-on programme.

iati-activity.title: Elimination of Blinding Trachoma in Malawi
iati-activity.description:
The programme is aimed at eliminating blinding trachoma in Malawi through support to the Ministry of Health to develop and roll out an effective Trachoma elimination programme.
Key activities include: ? Conduct Trachoma prevalence surveys in endemic districts ? Facilitate implementation of the SAFE strategy in districts that have been surveyed and proved to be Trachoma endemic following WHO guidelines
The programme is expected to contribute to a Malawi free of blinding Trachoma.

iati-activity.title: Malawi College of Health Sciences
iati-activity.description:
The Malawi College of Health Sciences Ophthalmic Training Programme aims at increasing quality and quantity of ophthalmic personnel in the country through the training of mid-level eye care professionals.
Among other activities the programme provides scholarships for mid-level cadres, i.e. Ophthalmic Clinical Officers and Cataract Surgeons. It also supports ophthalmic faculty development through technical assistance and continuous professional development for faculty members.
The ultimate aim of the programme is to reduce the level of blindness and visual impairment in Malawi.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening ECDE for Disabled Children in Malawi
iati-activity.description:
The goal of the project is to contribute to the development of best practices in the provision of quality early childhood development services for children with disabilities in the mainstream institutions.
Objectives: ? To build capacity of stakeholders at all levels to strengthen their roles in delivery and implementation of Early Childhood Development and Education for children with disabilities ? To provide services to develop best practices around implementation of inclusive practices in Early Childhood Development and Education. ? To advocate for promotion of inclusive ECDE practices by ECDE stakeholders using experiences and lessons from the project.
The large scale changes it is seeking to achieve include: ? Enhanced national capacity to implementation and deliver ECDE for children with disabilities at community level ? Encouraging the development and sharing of best practices around implementation of inclusive approaches to Early Childhood Development and Education

iati-activity.title: Support to National Eyecare Coordination
iati-activity.description:
The National Eye Care Coordination Programme is aimed at establishing an effective and efficient national eye care coordination system in the Ministry of Health in order to improve delivery of eye care services in Malawi in line with the V2020.
Specific objectives include: ? To raise the profile of eye health internally (Health sector) and externally ? To initiate a Trachoma elimination programme ? To promote integration of eye health with other health initiatives
Key activities include: ? Advocacy initiatives to leverage support to eye health issues in the country ? Promote networking with other civil society organisations on eye health ? Conduct Trachoma prevalence surveys in endemic districts ? Support NPBC Meetings
The programme is expected to build capacity of national eye care coordination structures and improve collaboration in delivery of eye health.

iati-activity.title: SWZ CES-Chikwawa
iati-activity.description:
The aim of the project is to ensure that everyone who is blind and visually impaired or at risk of blindness has access to eye health services.
Key activities include: ? Facilitate development of eye health plans using district health structures ? Facilitate provision of eye health services in health facilities ? Support District Health Officers to sensitize health centre committees on eye health issues and services ? Support district hospitals to carry out cataract surgeries and treat minor eye conditions ? Provide district hospitals with support to procure equipment, drugs and supplies The following outcomes are expected: ? Integration of eye health into the district health systems ? Increased uptake of eye care services by community members - demand stimulation through strengthened role of communities and their institutions in the planning and delivery of eye health services
The programme is under review and will be governed by a Letter of Understanding with the Ministry of Health in 2013.

iati-activity.title: Malawi School of Optometry
iati-activity.description:
To provide a sustainable solution to the problem of avoidable blindness in Southern Africa by addressing the significant shortage of local human resources through training optometry personnel.
Among other activities the programme provides scholarships for mid-level cadres namely Optometrists and Optometry Technicians. It also provides trainers.
The programme is contributing to the elimination of avoidable blindness caused by uncorrected refractive errors and impaired vision in Southern Africa.

iati-activity.title: Malawi Union of the Blind
iati-activity.description:
The programme is aimed at strengthening organisational capacity of Malawi Union of the Blind focussing on structures at different levels and their ability to advocate for specific issues affecting visually impaired people.
Objectives of the programme are: ? To strengthen MUB organizational capacity to effectively and efficiently implement its programmes. ? To increase the participation of blind persons in decentralized public decision-making service provision processes ? To enhance the participation of MUB in national and international advocacy activities
Key activities include: ? Conduct leadership training ? Support MUB members to attend international forums ? Conduct a business skills development training for women ? Conduct World Sight Day commemorations
The programme is expected to: ? Facilitate creation of space and voice for BPOs to engage in national development processes such as the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy and other relevant sectoral processes. ? Strengthen organizational capacity of BPOs and empowerment of their membership, e.g. strengthening of MUB branches.
